RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Ea ch $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOMTHING ELUSIVE broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside, shook clear of his pace rival entering the final turn, and increased his advantage late while under confident handling. ROLLIE'S SPIRIT stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, launched his bid four wide while looming a danger entering the final turn, and finished willingly three out from the rail in the drive. THERE GOES MY HERO tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, collared the leaders while commencing a three wide bid from between rivals entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive to garner a share. BETTER TONE saved ground through the first turn and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied one out from the rail entering the final turn, while looking for room, and finished evenly from along the rail in the stretch drive. CRYPTO MUNNY unhurried early while trailing the field in the run down the backstretch, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and finished five out from the rail in the drive while only able to outfinish a tiring rival. REMEMBERTHEALAMO away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of SOMTHING ELUSIVE entering the first turn, forced the issue from the outside of that rival in the run down the backside, was unable to match strides with his pace rival entering the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Somthing Elusive
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: There Goes My Hero
ENTRY.OWNER: Klimes Helen McDonald Jo-Anne and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Rememberthealamo
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Better Tone
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Rollie's Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Crypto Munny
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 4 wide, never menaced

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HE'S A SAINT away alertly and raced to the lead entering the first turn while saving ground at the rail, continued to dictate the pace in the run down the backstretch while racing out from the rail, maintained his advantage through the final turn, and widened his advantage late while drifting four wide in deep stretch. CAIRO CRUSADER broke sharply and tracked the pacesetter through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained his position in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. MAX BOOSTER away well and stalked the leader into the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, continued to save ground and gained a tracking trip in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon while finishing at the rail. STOLO SPIRIT settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late impact. HE'S GOLDEN settled at the back of a compact field entering the stretch the first time, saved ground through the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Cairo Crusader
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: He's Golden
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: He's a Saint
ENTRY.OWNER: Scott Robert Long William and McLeod Dan
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Max Booster
ENTRY.OWNER: Rocking Bar B Outfit Getson Larry and Getson Margaret
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Stolo Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 19000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, For Eac h $1,250 To $10,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROOKIE YEAR away alertly and was taken in hand and allowed to settle off the contested early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, crept closer in the run down the backside, launched his bid four wide entering the final turn, assumed command leaving the turn, and was all out to fend off a late surge by BROKE AN BROKEN to prevail. BROKE AN BROKEN settled off the battling leaders while saving ground at the rail entering the stretch the first time, rallied from just off the rail entering the final turn while being restrained while awaiting racing room, tipped four wide leaving the turn, and closed determinedly four wide in the lane to just miss. WISELY PLAYED away well and stalked the leaders into the lane the first time while racing one out from the rail, launched his bid three wide from between rivals entering the final turn, steadied slightly leaving the turn, and finished three wide in the drive to garner a share. SLOOP JOHN B broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from the rail in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was overtaken leaving the turn, and faded in the late going. BUZZINGA KARMA shifted off the rail entering the stretch the first time to duel for the early lead from the outside of SLOOP JOHN B, forced the issue from the outside of that rival in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's claim of foul. The rider of WISELY PLAYED lodged a claim of foul for alleged interference on the final turn. After review the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish

ENTRY.NAME: Buzzinga Karma
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Broke an Broken
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, waited 1/4-3/16, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Wisely Played
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Sutherland June Stajkowski Neil Hickman Barry and Small Lesley
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Rookie Year
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled 2w, rallied 4w, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Sloop John B
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, late fade

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OUR BLOKE broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch, repelled the challenge from KIKS LOVE OF LIFE through the final turn, and drew clear in the lane to prove best. EYES OF BEAUTY stalked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, pulled her way into a tracking trip in the run down the backside, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed willingly one out from the rail in the drive to get up for the place. FLYING MISS stalked the pacesetter two wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide through the final turn, and closed determinedly four wide in the drive to just miss the place. KIKIS LOVE OF LIFE away well and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue from the outside of OUR BLOKE through the final turn, struggled to keep tabs on that rival entering the lane, and was outfinished late while racing two out from the rail. ON MY GOOD SIDE away alertly and was allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground in the run down the backstretch, launched his bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished evenly from along the inside in the drive. FOREVER SUMMER unhurried early while dropping back to trail in the run to the first turn, bided her time at the back of the pack in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering he final turn, but failed to make a late impact when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Forever Summer
ENTRY.OWNER: Forster Stable and Blue Willow Dairy Ltd
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Eyes of Beauty
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: On My Good Side
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled inside, rallied rail, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Our Bloke
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Flying Miss
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Kikis Love of Life
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUST MAKE BELIEVE stalked the early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, continued to bid his time in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, shifted three wide for the drive, and closed determinedly to get up in the closing strides. PADDY D'ORO stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, collared the pacesetter two wide entering the final turn, got the better of his pace rival in mid stretch, but was unable to fend off the late surge by JUST MAKE BELIEVE late, but was clearly second best. DYNAMITER broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, controlled the pace through the second turn and in the run down the backstretch, battled through the final turn and into the lane from the inside of PADDY D'ORO, but faded in deep stretch. TIMELESS SHRUG unhurried early while dropping back to trail entering the first turn, remained well back in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but was only able to pass a tiring rival over the final furlong. VANCOUVER'S HUNTER away well and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time, began to drop back in the run down the backstretch, and had little to offer over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Vancouver's Hunter
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Just Make Believe
ENTRY.OWNER: Last Call Racing Stable and Bornn Cathy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2w, rallied inside, closed 3w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Paddy d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, led, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Timeless Shrug
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamiter
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, late fade

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Ea ch $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ENGLISH BAY TEDDY broke sharply and stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly two wide through the final turn, and closed willingly from along the rail in the drive to get up in time. BAK TO LIBERTY tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn while pressing the pacesetter, and battled three wide in the drive while drifting in slightly in deep stretch to just miss. GROOVIN' IS BAK stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and closed with late interest from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. TIZ THE PROSPECT away alertly and raced to the lead one out from the rail entering the backstretch, battled from the inside of BAK TO LIBERTY through the final turn and into the lane, checked in deep stretch when in tight quarters, and was through after that.

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz the Prospect
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, checked late

ENTRY.NAME: Bak to Liberty
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Groovin' Is Bak
ENTRY.OWNER: GO Stables and Ramirez Alexa Danae
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: English Bay Teddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 7 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 7 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3, 000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HARLAN'S ANGEL broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly three wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly four wide in the drive to get up in time. AMANDA settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, commenced her bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed one out from the rail from between rivals in deep stretch to just miss. JERSEY LILLIE away alertly and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, tipped two wide to launch her bid entering the final turn. assumed control midway through the turn, and just failed to late while drifting three wide late. PINEAPPLE TIDBITS unhurried early while dropping back to trail, commenced her bid from along the inside entering the final, tipped five wide entering the lane and finished with late interest. ANOTHERSUNNYDAY away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backside, was collared and quickly overtaken soon after entering the final turn, and faded in the late stages. RACINO settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, trailed the field into the final turn while commencing her bid at the rail, and finished with late interest from along the rail in the drive, but failed to make a serious late impact. ANAAMY stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but began to lose position early in the turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Jersey Lillie
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked rail, rallied 2 wide, led, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Pineapple Tidbits
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, just missed
